oai_dc:dc.dc:title: McClellan saddle
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: McClellan saddle displayed in the Humphreys County Museum. This is the 1904 Model of the McClellan design. They were made from 1904 until the late 1930s. When the horse cavalry was disbanded in 1943, thousands of these saddles were sold as surplus. They are often misidentified as Civil War era saddles.
